metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10910 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Symfony before 2.7.51, 2.8.x before 2.8.50, 3.x before 3.4.26, 4.x before 4.1.12, and 4.2.x before 4.2.7, when service ids allow user input, this could allow for SQL Injection and remote code execution. This is related to symfony/dependency-injection.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10910` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-symfony - 3.4.22+dfsg-2
php-symfony-amazon-mailer - 3.4.22+dfsg-2
php-symfony-asset - 3.4.22+dfsg-2
php-symfony-browser-kit - 3.4.22+dfsg-2

criterions.comment: symfony package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.4.22+dfsg-2').
